commit_message:
Fix for export attachments from volume

Volume contains list of attachments. Export of attachments into CSV as enumerated fields implemented.
Number of enumrations is added into config as CSV_VOLUME_ATTACHMENTS_NUM parameter.
Enumeration of keys paths implemented in export_utils.
Volume attachment skeleton added.

Change-Id: I63eb2217c3564457a8ff4a5396eb7e7c40a76321
Closes-Bug: #1434086
Closes-Bug: #1435224

Every keys seem to end with _package, enforce that policy to keys that
were missing the _package string at the end of their name.

commit_message:
overcloud-controller: Install Redis server

Install Redis server on the controller node.

It can be used as a backend for Tooz, eventually monitoring if Sensu is
the solution, and other purpose.

Change-Id: Iea8a3b67b0c29bcab3587a74ef2abb6260b947af

commit_message:
Enable to specify context on POST requests during unittests

NeutronDbPluginV2TestCase has a method 'new_create_request'
to send 'POST' request. But, it doesn't have a argument 'context'.
So, we can not execute create-test as a tenant-user(NOT admin user)

  e.g. FWaaS resources can not test with the context in creating.

This fix enables to specify 'context' when executing new_create_request.

Closes-Bug:  #1423470
Related-Bug: #1408236
Change-Id: Id8dc8cff87ca658e86c192b8da047f0c62989a4e

commit_message:
Updating horizon user guide to use new terminology

Update to change references to "Job" -> "Job Template"
and "Job Execution" -> "Job" to match the current reality
in the dashboard.

Change-Id: I528da9756f85d76aeeba9dd02ddfce6ec9e359cf
Closes-Bug: #1436842
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara refs/changes/60/168060/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Job Templates ------------- Job templates are where you define the type of job you'd like to run as well as which "Job Binaries" are required. 1) From the Data Processing/Jobs page, click on the "Create Job Template" button at the top right 2) Give your Job Template a name5) Enter an optional description for your Job Template 6) Click on the "Libs" tab and choose any libraries needed by your job templateJobsJobs are what you get by "Launching" a job template. You can monitor the1) From the Data Processing/Job Templates page, find the row that contains the job template you want to launch and click either "Launch on New Cluster" or "Launch on Existing Cluster" the right side of that row the Data Processing/Jobs panel 6) You can relaunch a Job from the Jobs page by using the - Create a Job Template - Navigate to Data Processing/Job Templates, Click on Create Job Template - To launch your job from the Job Templates page, click on the down arrow at the far right of the screen and choose "Launch on Existing Cluster" - You will be taken to the "Jobs" page where you can see your job - Create a Job Template - To launch your job from the Job Templates page, click on the down arrow at the far right of the screen and choose "Launch on Existing Cluster" - You will be taken to the "Jobs" page where you can see your job - The output is located at /tmp/spark-edp/<name of job template>/<job id>. An example of this would be trying to delete a Job Template that has an existing Job. In order to be able to delete that job, you would first need to delete any Job Templates that relate to that job.
deleted_lines: Jobs ---- Jobs are where you define the type of job you'd like to run as well as which "Job Binaries" are required 1) From the Data Processing/Jobs page, click on the "Create Job" button at the top right 2) Give your Job a name5) Enter an optional description for your Job 6) Click on the "Libs" tab and choose any libraries needed by your jobJob ExecutionsJob Executions are what you get by "Launching" a job. You can monitor the1) From the Data Processing/Jobs page, find the row that contains the job you want to launch and click on the "Launch Job" button at the right side of that row the Sahara/Job Executions panel 6) You can relaunch a Job Execution from the Job Executions page by using the - Create a Job - Navigate to Data Processing/Jobs, Click on Create Job - To launch your job from the Jobs page, click on the down arrow at the far right of the screen and choose "Launch on Existing Cluster" - You will be taken to the "Job Executions" page where you can see your job - Create a Job - To launch your job from the Jobs page, click on the down arrow at the far right of the screen and choose "Launch on Existing Cluster" - You will be taken to the "Job Executions" page where you can see your job - The output is located at /tmp/spark-edp/<name of job>/<job execution id>. An example of this would be trying to delete a Job that has an existing Job Execution. In order to be able to delete that job, you would first need to delete any Job Executions that relate to that job.

commit_message:
Proper errors handling for client

* Introduce a specific exception class (subclasses requests.HTTPError
  to be backward compatible)
* Fetch error message from response body
* i18nize existing errors

Change-Id: I71922895c3177720789c6933da79b8882bfa7127
Closes-Bug: #1428680
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector refs/changes/54/168354/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Also client now properly sets error message from the server in its exception. This might be a breaking change, if you relied on exception message previously.

commit_message:
Enable debug level for 'ntpd' time sync command

In order to investigate time synchronization issues
on slave nodes we need to increase verbosity of time
sync command.

Change-Id: I95e96cce5f08ae9c7c2339c1c2003cf6015cbee1
Related-bug: #1437223

commit_message:
Fix ownership issue with Zone's created on set fip

When a user sets a FloatingIP a Reverse Zone is created that's owned by the
system but if no managed_resource_tenant_id option was set then the Zone would
get owned by the context.tenant_id when create_domain() is called in
set_floatingip.

We fix it by changing the default managed_resource_tenant_id to
"00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000".

Closes-Bug: #1437060

Change-Id: I491309d92a9e3fba2f42af1ae85372b6258d53f3

commit_message:
puppet+devtest: make compute nodes reachable

Compute nodes run libvirt, which automatically creates a default network
which has the same address space (192.168.122.*) as the libvirt default
network on the host machine where devtest is running. This overlap
causes that when a compute node wants to send a packet to the host
machine (192.168.122.1) it gets incorrectly routed through the compute
node's own virbr0 instead of br-ex. The current solution does not seem
to be enough because libvirt gets started and creates the default
network before Puppet is triggered on compute nodes. Making sure the
libvirt default network is destroyed on the compute node fixes the
issue.

We don't have any puppet modules in OPM that would deal with libvirt
networks and it's probably not worth exploring and adding one because of
this small issue (i don't expect another use case of managing libvirt
networks directly), so i'm using an exec with proper idempotency
check.

Change-Id: Icde12aa204ed1f7fa35b0525875ce07db34dc42c
Closes-Bug: #1436822
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/10/168010/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # ensure libvirt default network isn't running to avoid colliding with # other IP address spaces, especially in virtualized deployments exec { 'livirt-default-net-disable-autostart': command => '/usr/bin/virsh net-autostart default --disable', onlyif => '/usr/bin/virsh net-info default | /bin/grep -i "^autostart:\s*yes"', } exec { 'livirt-default-net-destroy': command => '/usr/bin/virsh net-destroy default', onlyif => '/usr/bin/virsh net-info default | /bin/grep -i "^active:\s*yes"', }

commit_message:
Remove 'diff-based' repos support

In Fuel 6.1 we don't support diff-based repos. Moreover the whole
system was removed from the build system. Anyway, if one day we add
it back it definitely will require another implementation.

Related: blueprint consume-external-ubuntu
Related: blueprint separate-mos-from-linux

Change-Id: Ie40ad6c89ed07438db0cda518cd6de017c5c2905

commit_message:
Set amd64 architecture for dpkg

Since bp/separate-mos-from-linux the repo on the master node doesn't have
a package index for the i386 architecture. Meantime, by default Ubuntu
installer configures dpkg on slaves to use both amd64 and i386, which is
wrong because it's not intended.

This commit explicitly sets the architecture to use - 'amd64'.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1436459
Change-Id: If8a0225c51cec8862b90f9cc62e660b08b41edf8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/30/167930/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Select architecture to amd64. That's very important to dpkg, since # by default we have both amd64 and i386. d-i apt-setup/multiarch string amd64

commit_message:
Updated nova logic to correct issues with addon devices

The logic within the pre_tasks was too loose. The pre_tasks need
to have a bit more restrictive conditionals. Additionall the
`lxc-device add` command which is being used always exits 0
even when the device add fails. While the task does not have
issues with running we should be making sure that our changes
are being recoreded correctly.

Closes-Bug: 1434945
Change-Id: Icb1707db6bde6c0a26af6bca21a1f88dc3c315a8

commit_message:
Make the default for NODE_CNT less arbitrary

Reduce the number of nodes created on a virt host to 10 so that less
disk space is used. This makes a difference when devtest is run several
times on the same virt host as each time ironic will pick a different VM
on which to deploy nodes too, eventually the qcow being used in all the
defined domains will be more then just a blank image.

Related-Bug: #1414098

Change-Id: I442e2c5f36a5d40052285977303ce8fba57f94bf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator refs/changes/50/152150/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: export NODE_CNT=${NODE_CNT:-10}

subject: Upload Docker images from fuel-images.tar
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-27 16:11:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web/commit/ddf2608ee50adf1bb1d884e1812957f7fe899a2c', 'message': "Upload Docker images from fuel-images.tar

The patch I62abc07e79847b5c69eaa1a983575b214ebed649 introduced new
content for fuel-images.tar.lrz artifact and now we don't have images
per containers. Basically it means, that the fuel_upgrade script is
unable to load them and we need to load all the images from exactly one
tarbal - fuel-images.tar.

Change-Id: I7f5bad9315edffe6f4e1feb29c471fb7a5bfd22a
Related-Bug: #1336911
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-30 13:57:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web/commit/868b1b3c17e8ef599a56c82a4418c868e7a328a6', 'message': "Upload Docker images from fuel-images.tar

Since the patch I62abc07e79847b5c69eaa1a983575b214ebed649 we have a new
format of 'fuel-images.tar.lrz' artifact, so now it doesn't contain
images per container. Hence, we have to change the fuel_upgrade script
in order to fit these changes.

Basically it means that the script have to load just one file with all
images - fuel-images.tar.

Closes-Bug:  #1430221
Closes-Bug:  #1435314
Related-Bug: #1336911

commit_message:
Upload Docker images from fuel-images.tar

Since the patch I62abc07e79847b5c69eaa1a983575b214ebed649 we have a new
format of 'fuel-images.tar.lrz' artifact, so now it doesn't contain
images per container. Hence, we have to change the fuel_upgrade script
in order to fit these changes.

Basically it means that the script have to load just one file with all
images - fuel-images.tar.

Closes-Bug:  #1430221
Closes-Bug:  #1435314
Related-Bug: #1336911

Depends on: I15f5bf771cb95504791a55a02e412a40f330ecd9
Change-Id: I7f5bad9315edffe6f4e1feb29c471fb7a5bfd22a

commit_message:
Move aiopcpu to nova check queue

As the first step in seeing how stable tempest-dsvm-aiopcpu-full is,
make it non-voting on nova's check queue. tempest-dsvm-aiopcpu-full is
currently working (with live migration enabled!) but we don't have
enough data to understand what the success rate is for this job and if
its low enough to become the standard configuration.

The success rate of this job can be monitored via graphite and
logstash.openstack.org

Change-Id: I2152389f31e7ecd5290de77d45df8ffcbdacdb46

commit_message:
Fix check distro version for hadoop setup

It fails because now condition contains integer value,
but for CentOS or RHEL 'lsb_release -rs' gets version
with floating point.
The simple way to avoid this situation is adding check for
fedora distro.

Change-Id: Ie7035a824ea552487c296b234a4cc798995e42d5
Closes-bug: #1436803

commit_message:
upgrade: keep docker images in one tarball

The patch I62abc07e79847b5c69eaa1a983575b214ebed649 introduced new
content for fuel-images.tar.lrz artifact: now we don't have images
per container. Basically it means that the fuel_upgrade script is
unable to load them and we need to distribute the fuel-images.tar
(exactly tarball, not unpacked content) in order to load all
images at once.

Change-Id: I15f5bf771cb95504791a55a02e412a40f330ecd9
Related-Bug: #1336911

commit_message:
Separate API requets from the procuder in a basic client

Change-Id: I6dcc70a695aee102e5636bb29361306d35644484
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/faafo refs/changes/98/169198/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/env python # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import copy import json import random import uuid from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_log import log import requests from faafo import version LOG = log.getLogger('faafo.client') CONF = cfg.CONF producer_opts = [ cfg.BoolOpt("one-shot", default=False, help="Generate one set of tasks and exit."), cfg.IntOpt("max-height", default=1024, help="The maximum height of the generate image."), cfg.IntOpt("max-width", default=1024, help="The maximum width of the generated image."), cfg.FloatOpt("max-xa", default=-4.0, help="The maximum value for the parameter 'xa'."), cfg.FloatOpt("max-xb", default=4.0, help="The maximum value for the parameter 'xb'."), cfg.FloatOpt("max-ya", default=-3, help="The maximum value for the parameter 'ya'."), cfg.FloatOpt("max-yb", default=3, help="The maximum value for the parameter 'yb'."), cfg.IntOpt("max-iterations", default=512, help="The maximum number of iterations."), cfg.IntOpt("min-height", default=256, help="The minimum height of the generate image."), cfg.IntOpt("min-width", default=256, help="The minimum width of the generated image."), cfg.FloatOpt("min-xa", default=-1.0, help="The minimum value for the parameter 'xa'."), cfg.FloatOpt("min-xb", default=1.0, help="The minimum value for the parameter 'xb'."), cfg.FloatOpt("min-ya", default=-0.5, help="The minimum value for the parameter 'ya'."), cfg.FloatOpt("min-yb", default=0.5, help="The minimum value for the parameter 'yb'."), cfg.IntOpt("min-iterations", default=128, help="The minimum number of iterations."), cfg.IntOpt("min-tasks", default=1, help="The minimum number of generated tasks."), cfg.IntOpt("max-tasks", default=10, help="The maximum number of generated tasks."), cfg.IntOpt("interval", default=10, help="Interval in seconds."), cfg.StrOpt('endpoint-url', default='http://localhost:5000', help='API connection URL') ] CONF.register_opts(producer_opts) def list_opts(): """Entry point for oslo-config-generator.""" return [(None, copy.deepcopy(producer_opts))] def get_random_task(): random.seed() width = random.randint(CONF.min_width, CONF.max_width) height = random.randint(CONF.min_height, CONF.max_height) iterations = random.randint(CONF.min_iterations, CONF.max_iterations) xa = random.uniform(CONF.min_xa, CONF.max_xa) xb = random.uniform(CONF.min_xb, CONF.max_xb) ya = random.uniform(CONF.min_ya, CONF.max_ya) yb = random.uniform(CONF.min_yb, CONF.max_yb) task = { 'uuid': str(uuid.uuid4()), 'width': width, 'height': height, 'iterations': iterations, 'xa': xa, 'xb': xb, 'ya': ya, 'yb': yb } return task if __name__ == '__main__': log.register_options(CONF) log.set_defaults() CONF(project='client', prog='faafo-client', version=version.version_info.version_string()) log.setup(CONF, 'client', version=version.version_info.version_string()) random.seed() number = random.randint(CONF.min_tasks, CONF.max_tasks) LOG.info("generating %d task(s)" % number) for i in xrange(0, number): task = get_random_task() # NOTE(berendt): only necessary when using requests < 2.4.2 headers = {'Content-type': 'application/json', 'Accept': 'text/plain'} requests.post("%s/v1/fractal" % CONF.endpoint_url, json.dumps(task), headers=headers)

commit_message:
Divide ha scalability test to use swift rebalance check and not

- Issue with swift rebalance is set to won't fix for 6.0.1
so ha_flat_scalability test was divided into two separate tests:
with swift rebalance checks and without

Change-Id: I60d75f198faac54ae209d72b84d4695a0473309e
Closes-Bug: #1405783

Create cluster 2. Add 1 controller node 3. Deploy the cluster 4. Check swift ring rebalance 5. Add 2 controller nodes 6. Deploy changes 7. Check swift ring rebalance 8. Run network verification 9. Add 2 controller nodes 10. Deploy changes 11. Check swift ring rebalance 12. Run network verification 13. Run OSTF Snapshot ha_flat_scalability_with_swift """ self.env.revert_snapshot("ready_with_5_slaves") cluster_id = self.fuel_web.create_cluster( name=self.__class__.__name__, mode=DEPLOYMENT_MODE_HA ) self.fuel_web.update_nodes( cluster_id, { 'slave-01': ['controller'] } ) self.fuel_web.deploy_cluster_wait(cluster_id) self.env.make_snapshot("ha_flat_scalability_with_swift")

commit_message:
Specify memcache_pool.Token as keystone token driver

Keystone team has a strong warning in their documentation:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/keystone/configuration.html

to use keystone.token.persistence.backends.memcache_pool.Token
instead of keystone.token.persistence.backends.memcache.Token
specifically when deploying Keystone under eventlet.

Change-Id: I674ee3440bb26af942db2859ed6f8512cbc22fee
Partial-Bug: #1405549

commit_message:
Drac hardware introspection

The proposal presents the work required to add support for hardware
introspection for Dell Remove Access Controllers (DRAC) and being able
to register that information to the Node in Ironic leaving it in a
"ready state".

This is the stage 1 of proposing a spec for Kilo, in this stage we
should determine whether the idea is in the scope and in alignment with
project direction.

Change-Id: I5b0d91253faf61a2beb4d91b039e9d20b246bf28
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/20/125920/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =========================== DRAC Hardware Introspection =========================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ironic/+spec/drac-hardware-introspection The proposal presents the work required to add support for hardware introspection for Dell Remove Access Controllers (DRAC) and being able to register that information to the Node in Ironic leaving it in a "ready state". Problem description =================== Right now operators are required to populate all the informations about a specific Node manually in Ironic, this includes adding some of the physical characteristics like CPU arch, number of CPUs, Memory size and Disk size, and also to create a Port for each NIC that the Node may have. All these informations is usually provided by the vendor and in some cases they might even be incorrect. With DRAC it's possible to interrogate the hardware and discover the all those informations about the Node in a out-of-band fashion. We should use it to make the the registration of the resources less manual for Nodes using the DRAC driver and also to improve the reliability about those information since we will be asking the hardware directly and not relying on any spreadsheet that may be given by the vendor. Proposed change =============== Create DracVendorPassthru interface containing a method called 'introspect_hardware' which will talk to the BMC and find out the Node characteristics (CPU arch, number of CPUs, Memory size and Disk size) and populate its 'properties' attribute accordingly, the method will also get all the MAC addresses of all NICs that the Node may have and create a Port for each one of them.

commit_message:
eDeploy: Track no matching profile

Right now if no profile is matched for a node nothing will happen. We
should be able to tell the operators that a given node didn't match any
profile, so this patch is doing that by putting the node in maintenance
mode and indicating the error in the maintenance_reson field of the
Ironic node.

Change-Id: Ied286e39086b7e4cd404564b4deecee8f4a3ffd0

""" session = get_session(config) data_versions = dv_db.get_data_versions(session) printer = config.print_stdout line = "%-7s%-20s%-20s%-10s" printer(line, "id", "sync_status", "sync_tasks_status", "stale") printer(line, "--", "-----------", "-----------------", "-----") for dv in data_versions: printer(line, dv.id, dv.sync_status, dv.sync_tasks_status, dv.stale)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-25 11:19:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/sahara-extra/commit/9fe370defe65604648c1e433b690bc2d32640a52', 'message': 'Hiding DLO segment objects in listing operation

Change-Id: Ic8835ba170c52ebac405315b44d59b4935909d51
Closes-Bug: 1436278
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-26 10:55:21.000000000', 'files': ['hadoop-swiftfs/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/fs/swift/snative/SwiftNativeFileSystem.java', 'hadoop-swiftfs/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/fs/swift/TestSwiftFileSystemPartitionedUploads.java', 'hadoop-swiftfs/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/fs/swift/snative/SwiftNativeFileSystemStore.java'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/sahara-extra/commit/e464caa3ef95c6237739ac4ea1c15b73080a9562', 'message': "Hiding a pseudo-directory that contains DLO segments

In SwiftNativeFileSystem implementation,
writes DLO manifest and segments to same location.

    largefile         <- manifest file
    largefile/000001  <- 1st segment
    largefile/000002  <- 2nd segment

And querying Swift to list objects (delimiter=/),
returns two object that is same name (sorted by name).

    largefile    <- manifest file
    largefile/   <- pseudo-directory

listStatus method returns two objects at above.
But FileSystem spec cannot exists file and directory in same name.

This patch modified listStatus's behavior to fix that problems
1. Ignores pseudo-directory entry If same named objects found
2. When called listStatus with manifest file path, returns a manifest file
   instead of the segments. (currently, returns list of segments)

Change-Id: Ic8835ba170c52ebac405315b44d59b4935909d51
Closes-Bug: 1436278
"}]
commit_message:
Hiding a pseudo-directory that contains DLO segments

In SwiftNativeFileSystem implementation,
writes DLO manifest and segments to same location.

    largefile         <- manifest file
    largefile/000001  <- 1st segment
    largefile/000002  <- 2nd segment

And querying Swift to list objects (delimiter=/),
returns two object that is same name (sorted by name).

    largefile    <- manifest file
    largefile/   <- pseudo-directory

listStatus method returns two objects at above.
But FileSystem spec cannot exists file and directory in same name.

This patch modified listStatus's behavior to fix that problems
1. Ignores pseudo-directory entry If same named objects found
2. When called listStatus with manifest file path, returns a manifest file
   instead of the segments. (currently, returns list of segments)

Change-Id: Ic8835ba170c52ebac405315b44d59b4935909d51
Closes-Bug: 1436278

added_lines: String prevObjName = ""; prevObjName = name; } else { if (prevObjName.length() + 1 == name.length() && name.startsWith(prevObjName)) { // Ignore because this directory object is stored DLO segment file continue; } public FileStatus[] listSegments(FileStatus file, boolean newest) throws IOException { SwiftObjectPath prefix = ((SwiftFileStatus)file).getDLOPrefix(); if (prefix == null) { objects = listDirectory(prefix, true, newest, false);
deleted_lines: } else { public FileStatus[] listSegments(SwiftFileStatus file, boolean newest) throws IOException { if (file.getDLOPrefix() == null) { objects = listDirectory(file.getDLOPrefix(), true, newest, false);

tables to the neutron database.

commit_message:
Adds "approved" list of Liberty specs

Matching the layout of the Kilo directory, new specs get proposed in the
"approved" directory, and once merged will actually be approved.

Because git (and the docs jobs) don't like an empty "approved" directory a
'.keep' file is added there. This file can be removed once a real spec has been
added, similar to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/154870/

Change-Id: I834aa2ee23e51f431c6641ed26691c45d51bcbe5

commit_message:
Tag all Sahara packages

Some users wish to override the default package provider by their own.

Tag all packages with the 'openstack' to allow mass resource attributes
override using resource collectors.

Change-Id: Ic662043bcd19a930a47a6716be051561fceef5d7
Closes-bug: #1391209
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Use versioncmp for '::operatingsystemmajrelease' comparison

Use the builtin versioncmp() function for comparisons of the
'::operatingsystemmajrelease' fact. If that fact evaluates to a string,
regular arithmetric comparisons will fail under the Puppet 4.x
language.

Change-Id: Ib55dabd3c33f5773ac3ca67955e0f85418ec0698
Closes-bug: 1425300
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-cinder refs/changes/00/168700/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if (versioncmp($::operatingsystemmajrelease, '7') >= 0) {

commit_message:
Add error handling for _get_online_controller func

Now in case when no online controllers have been found by
_get_online_controller function from statistics.utils module custom
exception is thrown. In oswl_collector's code corresponding exception
handling block is added.

Change-Id: Ia4a2e4b8a28443e784cd7ade8f38af58d22f3003
Closes-Bug: #1435173

commit_message:
Set galera clustercheck available_when_donor to 1

AVAILABLE_WHEN_DONOR should be 1 as Fuel configures
a non-blocking xtrabackup replication and HAproxy
backend for donor should report as available.

That would improve the UX with the full cluster
reassemble replication time - the donor node will
be ready for service ASAP

Change-Id: I9044a38fb651573a7428b9a9d0bd9d209cb5dcb5
Closes-bug: #1437816
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/03/168803/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: AVAILABLE_WHEN_DONOR=${3:-1}

Fixed test to work with random PYTHONHASHSEED

to compare objects, that contains nested collections new method
assertJsonEqual was used. Its usage allows not to rely on constant
order of nested collections elements.

Add a simple script to install FAAFO from PyPi

Change-Id: Ib1113d4da0945d9f2181bd4796e70c34c9856940

added_lines: #!/bin/bash # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. if [[ -e /etc/os-release ]]; then source /etc/os-release if [[ $ID = 'centos' || $ID = 'fedora' || $ID = 'rhel' ]]; then sudo yum install -y python-dev python-pip elif [[ $ID = 'ubuntu' || $ID = 'debian' ]]; then sudo apt-get install -y python-devel python-pip elif [[ $ID = 'opensuse' || $ID = 'sles' ]]; then sudo zypper install -y python-devel python-pip else exit 1 fi sudo pip install faafo else exit 1 fi

subject: Prevent unintentional detaching volume from instance
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-23 04:41:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-cinderclient/commit/d725755d0712b5884ec79a4281a2c22e0f512ee7', 'message': 'Prevent unintentional detaching volume from instance

There is a case that unintentional volume is detached from instance
in terminate instance API.
Because in _shutdown_instance(), all volume block device mapping is
collected and detached by the condition of volume id.
So, if instance has redundant volume block device mapping which made
by attaching failure, terminate instance API detach another volume.
This patch checks consistency of detaching volume and instance
between nova and cinder.

Change-Id: I96617061fd0d5d1c971cc35e47958733ff3b6199
Partial-Bug: #1377161

commit_message:
Prevent unintentional detaching volume from instance

There is a case that unintentional volume is detached from instance
in terminate instance API.
Because in _shutdown_instance(), all volume block device mapping is
collected and detached by the condition of volume id.
So, if instance has redundant volume block device mapping which made
by attaching failure, terminate instance API detach another volume.
This patch checks consistency of detaching volume and instance
between nova and cinder.

Change-Id: I96617061fd0d5d1c971cc35e47958733ff3b6199
Partial-Bug: #1377161

commit_message:
Use modern versions of the oslo packages

Update to use oslo_* instead of olso.* everywhere and update the
requirements files accordingly. Align with global requirements.

Change-Id: Ie881223de9a6f2f661e386d0842c0394da107188

commit_message:
qpid: Always auto-delete queue of DirectConsumer

In case of the call()er die, the queue used to reply must be
automatically deleted, otherwise they will never been deleted.

This is done in the same way as the rabbit drivers does,
by enabling auto-delete on this queue.

Change-Id: Ib01981d704b8849e0115791ff90fbb74cbac421f
Closes-Bug: #1374519
(cherry picked from commit 1640cc17031bde765d7e272c2e65993c4b270a45)

commit_message:
Fix API links and labels

Per email discussion[1], v2.1 API is our CURRENT when we get to kilo and
v2 is SUPPORTED. Added links to the v2.1 API, v2 API and v2 extensions
API in our documentation

[1] http://markmail.org/message/p32p5jbvvjedg657

Depends-On: Ibe990ec93d8f9d18ef21c28979e180472df6a33d
Closes-Bug: #1435507
Change-Id: Iaa62be9612dd039f7669ff2b5587c922aba54093

commit_message:
Add notification flag (True / False) to extension_manager
process_update_port

Extension manager didn't return any value regarding notify of update
port. This means that changes in a port via the ml2 extension manager
were ignored.
This fix adds return value (if needed) from all extension drivers.

Closes-Bug:1427641

Change-Id: I352d06146517c9ce3a02615bc9c0ec3be4f7f857

Change-Id: I39c5c99703fcd8e2c2fc20281ca5148155e6140b
Signed-off-by: root <root@localhost>
Signed-off-by: nuritv <nuritv@mellanox.com>

commit_message:
Reloading of worker's number in ProcessLauncher added

ProcessLauncher reloads configuration of running services
when SIGHUP signal is received. But changing of service's
worker number in nova.conf didn't give any effect.
This functionality allows user to change number of workers
by changing configuration in nova.conf and sending SIGHUP
signal to parent process of running services.

Change-Id: Id8ab337b2efc41fec0f2977a0d893fe8864f5ebe
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/45/161145/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def __init__(self, service): self.workers = service.get_workers_count() def launch_service(self, service): wrap = ServiceWrapper(service) self._reload_config() self._terminate_child(pid) @staticmethod def _terminate_child(pid): try: os.kill(pid, signal.SIGTERM) except OSError as exc: if exc.errno != errno.ESRCH: raise def _reload_config(self): cfg.CONF.reload_config_files() visited_wrappers = [] tmp_copy = dict(self.children) reload_conf_childs = set(tmp_copy.keys()) for pid in tmp_copy: service_wrap = tmp_copy[pid] wrapper_id = id(service_wrap) if wrapper_id in visited_wrappers: continue visited_wrappers.append(wrapper_id) new_conf_workers = service_wrap.service.get_workers_count() new_workers_count = new_conf_workers - service_wrap.workers service_wrap.workers = new_conf_workers if new_workers_count > 0: LOG.info(_LI('Starting %d workers'), new_workers_count) while len(service_wrap.children) < service_wrap.workers: self._start_child(service_wrap) elif new_workers_count < 0: obsolete_workers = - new_workers_count LOG.info(_LI('Stopping %d workers'), obsolete_workers) for kill_counter, pid in enumerate(service_wrap.children): if kill_counter >= obsolete_workers: break reload_conf_childs.remove(pid) self._terminate_child(pid) for pid in reload_conf_childs: os.kill(pid, signal.SIGHUP) def get_workers_count(self): """Get workers count.""" return 1 def launch(service): workers = service.get_workers_count() launcher.launch_service(service)
deleted_lines: def __init__(self, service, workers): self.workers = workers def launch_service(self, service, workers=1): wrap = ServiceWrapper(service, workers) for pid in self.children: os.kill(pid, signal.SIGHUP) try: os.kill(pid, signal.SIGTERM) except OSError as exc: if exc.errno != errno.ESRCH: raisedef launch(service, workers=1): launcher.launch_service(service, workers=workers)

commit_message:
Reloading of worker's number in ProcessLauncher added

ProcessLauncher reloads configuration of running services
when SIGHUP signal is received. But changing of service's
worker number in nova.conf didn't give any effect.
This functionality allows user to change number of workers
by changing configuration in nova.conf and sending SIGHUP
signal to parent process of running services.

Change-Id: I99379e77957d906f0dabb0c2497fc4627dbd6cc7

commit_message:
rest: add more operators in complex queries

Following the improvement done in the SQLAlchemy indexer driver, add
support in the REST API for more symbols.

Change-Id: I0dbeec7746b4eccb02d2fff376a500e01c68c792

commit_message:
Support for Configuration Language: Chef

Adds support for Chef as configuration language
in the execution plans.

Change-Id: Id689f94df6c43ac9ec150f0d80d21a525ba7048b
Co-Authored-By: Kirill Zaitsev <kzaitsev@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Support non-application scripts in the execution plan

Adds support for a custom entry point for non-application scripts

Change-Id: I87d03a225c61bf7340d88d6444b054d3ba438fbf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano-agent refs/changes/75/165375/24 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2015 Telefonica I+D # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import bunch import fixtures import mock from muranoagent import app from muranoagent.common import config as cfg from muranoagent import exceptions as exc from muranoagent.tests import base from muranoagent.tests import execution_plan as ep CONF = cfg.CONF class TestApp(base.MuranoAgentTestCase, fixtures.FunctionFixture): @mock.patch('os.path.exists') def setUp(self, mock_path): super(TestApp, self).setUp() mock_path.return_value = True self.agent = app.MuranoAgent() CONF.set_override('storage', 'cache') def test_verify_execution_plan_downloable(self): template = self.useFixture(ep.ExPlanDownloable()).execution_plan returned = self.agent._verify_plan(template) self.assertEqual(returned, None) def test_verify_execution_plan_wrong_format(self): template = bunch.Bunch( ID='ID', FormatVersion='0.0.0', ) result = self.agent._verify_plan(template) exception = \ exc.AgentException(3, 'Unsupported format version {0} ' '(must be equal to {1})'. format('0.0.0', '2.0.0')) self.assertEqual(exception._additional_data, result._additional_data) self.assertEqual(exception._error_code, result._error_code) self.assertEqual(exception.args, result.args) self.assertEqual(exception.message, result.message) def test_verify_execution_application(self): template = self.useFixture(ep.ExPlanApplication()).execution_plan returned = self.agent._verify_plan(template) self.assertEqual(returned, None) def test_verify_execution_plan_no_files(self): template = self.useFixture(ep.ExPlanDownloableNoFiles()).execution_plan result = self.agent._verify_plan(template) exception = exc.AgentException(2, "Files is not in the execution plan") self.assertEqual(exception._additional_data, result._additional_data) self.assertEqual(exception._error_code, result._error_code) self.assertEqual(exception.args, result.args) self.assertEqual(exception.message, result.message)

commit_message:
Support for Configuration Language. File Downloading

Execution plan files can be tranfered as binaries as just an URL to be download.
This code download the file when it is a URL

Partially-Implements Blueprint: conf-language-support

Change-Id: I102546a04a93dc74a4647cc8ad7a33d78ebca86b

commit_message:
Refactored test in linux_net to pass with random PYTHONHASHSEED

Previous implementation wraps dns list into set.
With random PYTHONHASHSEED set elements iteration order
wasn't guaranteed.

Partial-Bug: #1348818

Change-Id: Iffdaf7d75ef2131c9d9fc7aa075c95b5569902c2

added_lines: from greenlet import GreenletExitfrom swift.common.storage_policy import (POLICIES, REPL_POLICY, EC_POLICY, ECDriverError) def __init__(self, path, policy, internal_app_iters, range_specs, obj_length, logger): self.path = path self.logger = logger if fragment[0] == ' ': raise Exception('Leading whitespace on fragment.') except GreenletExit: # killed by contextpool pass except ChunkReadTimeout: # unable to resume in GetOrHeadHandler pass self.logger.exception("Exception fetching fragments for %r" % self.path) try: segment = self.policy.decode_fragments(fragments) except ECDriverError: self.logger.exception("Error decoding fragments for %r" % self.path) raise req.swift_entity_path, obj_length, logger=self.app.logger))
deleted_lines: from swift.common.storage_policy import POLICIES, REPL_POLICY, EC_POLICY def __init__(self, policy, internal_app_iters, range_specs, obj_length): self.logger.exception("Exception fetching fragments") segment = self.policy.decode_fragments(fragments) obj_length))

subject: A new UX design for Customization Script
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-27 00:34:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/ba1b52cebc327c2dc3251dc7fa7844ceb252e8d2', 'message': "A new UX design for Customization Script

Current UX design for Customization Script in Configuration step
of Launch Instance work flow is:

Showing a Customization Script Source dropdown list with options:
  * None - No script.
  * Direct Input - when selected, show a <textarea> for user's input.
  * File - when select, show <input type='file'> for user to select
    and load script from a file.

While the new design is
  * No Customization Script Source dropdown.
  * Always show a textarea for user's input.
  * If user leave the textare empty, mean no script.
  * If user inputs some script in the textarea, that will be the
    costumization script.
  * There is <input type='file'> on screen close to the textarea,
    user can click on it and select a file to load into the tesxtarea,
    user can see the content, and can edit on, until get satisfied.
  * There is an indicator showing the number of charactors in the
    textarea and validation message.

The new design is more intuitive, easy for user to underatnd, input
and edit. It conbines the three options into one case.

Change-Id: If137fda45ffed53532d5cf2d78bda5962f3badbd

commit_message:
A new UX design for Customization Script

Current UX design for Customization Script in Configuration step
of Launch Instance work flow is:

Showing a Customization Script Source dropdown list with options:
  * None - No script.
  * Direct Input - when selected, show a <textarea> for user's input.
  * File - when select, show <input type='file'> for user to select
    and load script from a file.

While the new design is
  * No Customization Script Source dropdown.
  * Always show a textarea for user's input.
  * If user leave the textare empty, mean no script.
  * If user inputs some script in the textarea, that will be the
    costumization script.
  * There is <input type='file'> on screen close to the textarea,
    user can click on it and select a file to load into the tesxtarea,
    user can see the content, and can edit on, until get satisfied.
  * There is an indicator showing the number of charactors in the
    textarea and validation message.

The new design is more intuitive, easy for user to underatnd, input
and edit. It conbines the three options into one case.

Co-Authored-By: Brian Tully <brian.tully@hp.com>
Change-Id: If137fda45ffed53532d5cf2d78bda5962f3badbd

subject: To optimize the attach_volume code
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-13 03:29:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/e0407b9434daef13f7380ab8b4acf349b0b42852', 'message': 'To optimize the attach_volume code

Put some parameters detection operations in the front can improve the
performance.

Change-Id: I5c1047fd602a2973d2561b696931c2c82f839781
Fixes: bug #1356172
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-08-14 12:32:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/a358b497b804e46cb388057131f82a73a7e36016', 'message': "To optimize the attach_volume code

At the time of update DB will return to the Volume of information, this
time the Volume is the latest information, so, wo don't get Volume from DB
after the update operation.

Change-Id: I5c1047fd602a2973d2561b696931c2c82f839781
Fixes: bug #1356172
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2014-08-15 00:50:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/9d3a2df8b2bfd0ed1fb3f6c78c54e52c0b5d512a', 'message': "To optimize the attach_volume code

At the time of update DB will return to the Volume of information, this
time the Volume is the latest information, so, wo don't get Volume from DB
after the update operation.

commit_message:
To optimize the attach_volume code

At the time of update DB will return to the Volume of information, this
time the Volume is the latest information, so, wo don't get Volume from DB
after the update operation.

Change-Id: I5c1047fd602a2973d2561b696931c2c82f839781
Closes-Bug: #1356172

added_lines: "POT-Creation-Date: 2015-03-30 18:04+0000\n" "PO-Revision-Date: 2015-03-30 18:04+0000\n""to groups while a group has a list of roles. OpenStack services reference " "the roles of the user attempting to access the service. The OpenStack policy" " enforcer middleware takes into consideration the policy rule associated " "with each resource then the user's group/roles and association to determine " "if access is allowed to the requested resource.""The policy enforcement middleware enables fine-grained access control to ""access to various management functionality. The cloud users would only be " "able to spin up instances, attach volumes, and perform other operational " "tasks." msgstr """Cloud administrators must define a user with the role of admin for each " "service, as described in the <link href=\"http://docs.openstack.org/admin-" "guide-cloud/content/index.html\"><citetitle>OpenStack Cloud Administrator " "Guide</citetitle></link>. This service account provides the service with the" " authorization to authenticate users." msgstr """The Compute and Object Storage services can be configured to use the " "Identity service to store authentication information. Other options to store" " authentication information include the use of the \"tempAuth\" file, " "however this should not be deployed in a production environment as the " "password is displayed in plain text."#: ./security-guide/ch_identity.xml185(para)#: ./security-guide/ch_identity.xml195(para)#: ./security-guide/ch_identity.xml199(para)#: ./security-guide/ch_identity.xml205(para)#: ./security-guide/ch_identity.xml220(title)#: ./security-guide/ch_identity.xml221(para)"guidance in the use of multi-factor authentication for network access to "#: ./security-guide/ch_identity.xml230(title)#: ./security-guide/ch_identity.xml231(para)#: ./security-guide/ch_identity.xml238(title)#: ./security-guide/ch_identity.xml239(para)#: ./security-guide/ch_identity.xml244(para)#: ./security-guide/ch_identity.xml249(para)#: ./security-guide/ch_identity.xml252(para)#: ./security-guide/ch_identity.xml260(title)#: ./security-guide/ch_identity.xml261(para)#: ./security-guide/ch_identity.xml272(para)#: ./security-guide/ch_identity.xml276(para)#: ./security-guide/ch_identity.xml281(para)#: ./security-guide/ch_identity.xml288(title)#: ./security-guide/ch_identity.xml289(para)#: ./security-guide/ch_identity.xml298(para)#: ./security-guide/ch_identity.xml304(para)#. When image changes, this message will be marked fuzzy or untranslated for #. you. #. It doesn't matter what you translate it to: it's not used at all. #: ./security-guide/section_secure-reference-architectures.xml58(None) #: ./security-guide/section_secure-reference-architectures.xml62(None) msgid "" "@@image: 'static/secure-arch-ref-1.png'; " "md5=121169233c45b935f55a2603543723f5" msgstr "" #. When image changes, this message will be marked fuzzy or untranslated for #. you. #. It doesn't matter what you translate it to: it's not used at all. #: ./security-guide/section_secure-reference-architectures.xml104(None) #: ./security-guide/section_secure-reference-architectures.xml108(None) msgid "" "@@image: 'static/secure-arch-ref-2.png'; " "md5=6d5c53c319bed5beccf7c7a1ba712637" msgstr "" #. When image changes, this message will be marked fuzzy or untranslated for #. you. #. It doesn't matter what you translate it to: it's not used at all. #: ./security-guide/section_secure-reference-architectures.xml160(None) #: ./security-guide/section_secure-reference-architectures.xml164(None) msgid "" "@@image: 'static/secure-arch-ref-3.png'; " "md5=d1e5c7103c9e9311536529413b93e9de" msgstr "" #. When image changes, this message will be marked fuzzy or untranslated for #. you. #. It doesn't matter what you translate it to: it's not used at all. #: ./security-guide/section_secure-reference-architectures.xml189(None) #: ./security-guide/section_secure-reference-architectures.xml193(None) msgid "" "@@image: 'static/secure-arch-ref-4.png'; " "md5=68dad0a758d3a5647e01404e49510333" msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_secure-reference-architectures.xml8(title) msgid "Secure reference architectures" msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_secure-reference-architectures.xml9(para) msgid "" "We recommend using SSL/TLS on both public networks and management networks " "in <xref linkend=\"tls-proxies-and-http-services\"/>. However, if actually " "deploying SSL/TLS everywhere is too difficult, we recommend evaluating your " "OpenStack SSL/TLS needs and following one of the architectures discussed " "here." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_secure-reference-architectures.xml15(para) msgid "" "The first thing one should do when evaluating their OpenStack SSL/TLS needs " "is to identify the threats. You can divide these threats into external and " "internal attacker categories, but the lines tend to get blurred since " "certain components of OpenStack operate on both the public and management " "networks." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_secure-reference-architectures.xml20(para) msgid "" "For publicly facing services, the threats are pretty straightforward. Users " "will be authenticating against horizon and keystone with their username and " "password. Users will also be accessing the API endpoints for other services " "using their keystone tokens. If this network traffic is unencrypted, " "passwords and tokens can be intercepted by an attacker using a man-in-the-" "middle attack. The attacker can then use these valid credentials to perform " "malicious operations. All real deployments should be using SSL/TLS to " "protect publicly facing services." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_secure-reference-architectures.xml29(para) msgid "" "For services that are deployed on management networks, the threats aren't so" " clear due to the bridging of security domains with network security. There " "is always the chance that an administrator with access to the management " "network decides to do something malicious. SSL/TLS isn't going to help in " "this situation if the attacker is allowed to access the private key. Not " "everyone on the management network would be allowed to access the private " "key of course, so there is still value in using SSL/TLS to protect yourself " "from internal attackers. Even if everyone that is allowed to access your " "management network is 100% trusted, there is still a threat that an " "unauthorized user gains access to your internal network by exploiting a " "misconfiguration or software vulnerability. One must keep in mind that you " "have users running their own code on instances in the OpenStack Compute " "nodes, which are deployed on the management network. If a vulnerability " "allows them to break out of the hypervisor, they will have access to your " "management network. Using SSL/TLS on the management network can minimize the" " damage that an attacker can cause." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_secure-reference-architectures.xml48(title) msgid "SSL/TLS proxy in front" msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_secure-reference-architectures.xml49(para) msgid "" "It is generally accepted that it is best to encrypt sensitive data as early " "as possible and decrypt it as late as possible. Despite this best practice, " "it seems that it's common to use a SSL/TLS proxy in front of the OpenStack " "services and use clear communication afterwards as shown below:" msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_secure-reference-architectures.xml65(para) msgid "" "Some of the concerns with the use of SSL/TLS proxies as pictured above:" msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_secure-reference-architectures.xml68(para) msgid "" "Native SSL/TLS in OpenStack services does not perform/scale as well as SSL " "proxies (particularly for Python implementations like Eventlet)." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_secure-reference-architectures.xml74(para) msgid "" "Native SSL/TLS in OpenStack services not as well scrutinized/ audited as " "more proven solutions." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_secure-reference-architectures.xml79(para) msgid "" "Native SSL/TLS configuration is difficult (not well documented, tested, or " "consistent across services)." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_secure-reference-architectures.xml84(para) msgid "" "Privilege separation (OpenStack service processes should not have direct " "access to private keys used for SSL/TLS)." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_secure-reference-architectures.xml89(para) msgid "Traffic inspection needs for load balancing." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_secure-reference-architectures.xml94(para) msgid "" "All of the above are valid concerns, but none of them prevent SSL/TLS from " "being used on the management network. Let's consider the next deployment " "model." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_secure-reference-architectures.xml99(title) msgid "SSL/TLS on same physical hosts as API endpoints" msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_secure-reference-architectures.xml111(para) msgid "" "This is very similar to the <link linkend=\"ssl-tls-proxy-in-" "front\">\"SSL/TLS in front model\" </link> but the SSL/TLS proxy is on the " "same physical system as the API endpoint. The API endpoint would be " "configured to only listen on the local network interface. All remote " "communication with the API endpoint would go through the SSL/TLS proxy. With" " this deployment model, we address a number of the bullet points in <link " "linkend=\"ssl-tls-proxy-in-front\">\"SSL/TLS in front model\" </link>. A " "proven SSL implementation that performs well would be used. The same SSL " "proxy software would be used for all services, so SSL configuration for the " "API endpoints would be consistent. The OpenStack service processes would not" " have direct access to the private keys used for SSL/TLS, as you would run " "the SSL proxies as a different user and restrict access using permissions " "(and additionally mandatory access controls using something like SELinux). " "We would ideally have the API endpoints listen on a Unix socket such that we" " could restrict access to it using permissions and mandatory access controls" " as well. Unfortunately, this does not seem to work currently in Eventlet " "from our testing. It is a good future development goal." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_secure-reference-architectures.xml133(title) msgid "SSL/TLS over load balancer" msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_secure-reference-architectures.xml134(para) msgid "" "What about high availability or load balanced deployments that need to " "inspect traffic? The previous deployment model (<link linkend=\"ssl-tls-" "proxy-on-same-physical-hosts-as-api-endpoints\">SSL/TLS on same physical " "hosts as API endpoints</link>) would not allow for deep packet inspection " "since the traffic is encrypted. If the traffic only needs to be inspected " "for basic routing purposes, it might not be necessary for the load balancer " "to have access to the unencrypted traffic. HAProxy has the ability to " "extract the SSL/TLS session ID during the handshake, which can then be used " "to achieve session affinity (<link " "href=\"http://blog.exceliance.fr/2011/07/04/maintain-affinity-based-on-ssl-" "session-id/\">configuration details here</link>). HAProxy can also use the " "TLS Server Name Indication (SNI) extension to determine where traffic should" " be routed to (<link href=\"http://blog.exceliance.fr/2012/04/13/enhanced-" "ssl-load-balancing-with-server-name-indication-sni-tls-" "extension/\">configuration details here</link>). These features likely cover" " some of the most common load balancer needs. HAProxy would be able to just " "pass the HTTPS traffic straight through to the API endpoint systems in this " "case:" msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_secure-reference-architectures.xml169(title) msgid "Cryptographic seperation of external and internal environments" msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_secure-reference-architectures.xml170(para) msgid "" "What if you want cryptographic separation of your external and internal " "environments? A public cloud provider would likely want their public facing " "services (or proxies) to use certificates that are issued by a CA that " "chains up to a trusted Root CA that is distributed in popular web browser " "software for SSL/TLS. For the internal services, one might want to instead " "use their own PKI to issue certificates for SSL/TLS. This cryptographic " "separation can be accomplished by terminating SSL at the network boundary, " "then re-encrypting using the internally issued certificates. The traffic " "will be unencrypted for a brief period on the public facing SSL/TLS proxy, " "but it will never be transmitted over the network in the clear. The same re-" "encryption approach that is used to achieve cryptographic separation can " "also be used if deep packet inspection is really needed on a load balancer. " "Here is what this deployment model would look like:" msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_secure-reference-architectures.xml196(para) msgid "" "As with most things, there are trade-offs. The main trade-off is going to be" " between security and performance. Encryption has a cost, but so does being " "hacked. The security and performance requirements are going to be different " "for every deployment, so how SSL/TLS is used will ultimately be an " "individual decision." msgstr ""
deleted_lines: "POT-Creation-Date: 2015-03-26 08:13+0000\n" "PO-Revision-Date: 2015-03-26 08:14+0000\n""to groups. A group has a list of roles. OpenStack services reference the " "roles of the user attempting to access the service. The OpenStack policy " "enforcer middleware takes into consideration the policy rule associated with" " each resource and the user's group/roles and tenant association to " "determine if he/she has access to the requested resource.""The Policy enforcement middleware enables fine-grained access control to ""access to various management functionality. The cloud tenant would be able " "to only spin up instances, attach volumes, etc." msgstr "ポリシー強制ミドルウェアにより OpenStack リソースに細かなアクセス制御を実現できます。管理ユーザーのみが新しいユーザーを作成でき、さまざまな管理機能にアクセスできます。クラウドのテナントはインスタンスの稼動、ボリュームの接続などのみが実行できます。""As described in the <link href=\"http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide-" "cloud/content/index.html\"><citetitle>OpenStack Cloud Administrator " "Guide</citetitle></link>, cloud administrators must define a user for each " "service, with a role of Admin. This service user account provides the " "service with the authorization to authenticate users." msgstr "<link href=\"http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide-cloud/content/index.html\"><citetitle>OpenStack Cloud Administrator Guide</citetitle></link> に記載されているとおり、クラウド管理者は各サービスに対して Admin ロールを持つユーザーを定義する必要があります。このサービスユーザーアカウントは、サービスがユーザーを認証するための権限を提供します。""The Compute and Object Storage services can be configured to use either the " "\"tempAuth\" file or Identity service to store authentication information. " "The \"tempAuth\" solution MUST NOT be deployed in a production environment " "since it stores passwords in plain text."#: ./security-guide/ch_identity.xml184(para)#: ./security-guide/ch_identity.xml194(para)#: ./security-guide/ch_identity.xml198(para)#: ./security-guide/ch_identity.xml204(para)#: ./security-guide/ch_identity.xml219(title)#: ./security-guide/ch_identity.xml220(para)"guidance in the use of multi factor authentication for network access to "#: ./security-guide/ch_identity.xml229(title)#: ./security-guide/ch_identity.xml230(para)#: ./security-guide/ch_identity.xml237(title)#: ./security-guide/ch_identity.xml238(para)#: ./security-guide/ch_identity.xml243(para)#: ./security-guide/ch_identity.xml248(para)#: ./security-guide/ch_identity.xml251(para)#: ./security-guide/ch_identity.xml259(title)#: ./security-guide/ch_identity.xml260(para)#: ./security-guide/ch_identity.xml271(para)#: ./security-guide/ch_identity.xml275(para)#: ./security-guide/ch_identity.xml280(para)#: ./security-guide/ch_identity.xml287(title)#: ./security-guide/ch_identity.xml288(para)#: ./security-guide/ch_identity.xml297(para)#: ./security-guide/ch_identity.xml303(para)

commit_message:
fixed tests in test_simple_tenant_usage to pass with random PYTHONHASHSEED

refactored fake implementation of instance_get_active_by_window_joined.
if project_id is not None current version generates instances only with
passed project id

Partial-Bug: #1348818

Change-Id: I0fcb61ba6b9ff8a4f0075333048adba66d1c8811

commit_message:
Small refactoring in engine, task handler and workflow utils

* Renaming methods in task_handler
* Deleted unused method in workflow/utils.py
* Made signature of on_task_state_change more consistent with other
  methods
* Other minor things

Change-Id: Iaa83d3cdbd1836366401cb5558f194181b421511

commit_message:
Fixing 'with-items' functionality

After refactoring 'with-items' was broken

Implements blueprint mistral-with-items

Change-Id: I8d2ef1b9cd6ff8c06ee9e837c72fafe38ae6c002
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/99/167599/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from mistral.workflow import statesdef prepare_runtime_context(task_ex, task_spec, input_dicts): 'count': len(input_dicts) } def is_iterations_completed(task_ex): completed = all([states.is_completed(ex.state) for ex in task_ex.executions]) return completed
deleted_lines: import copy from mistral import expressions as expr # TODO(rakhmerov): The module should probably go into task_handler. def get_result(task_ex, task_spec, result): """Returns result from task markered as with-items Examples of result: 1. Without publish clause: { "task": { "task1": [None] } } Note: In this case we don't create any specific result to prevent generating large data in DB. Note: None here used for calculating number of finished iterations. 2. With publish clause and specific result key: { "result": [ "result1", "result2" ], "task": { "task1": { "result": [ "result1", "result2" ] } } } """ e_data = result.error expr_ctx = copy.deepcopy(task_ex.in_context) or {} expr_ctx[task_ex.name] = copy.deepcopy(result.data) or {} # Calc result for with-items (only list form is used). result = expr.evaluate_recursively(task_spec.get_publish(), expr_ctx) if not task_ex.result: task_ex.result = {} task_result = copy.copy(task_ex.result) res_key = _get_result_key(task_spec) if res_key: if res_key in task_result: task_result[res_key].append( result.get(res_key) or e_data ) else: task_result[res_key] = [result.get(res_key) or e_data] # Add same result to task result under key 'task'. # TODO(rakhmerov): Fix this during task result refactoring. # task_result[t_name] = # { # res_key: task_result[res_key] # } # else: # if 'task' not in task_result: # task_result.update({'task': {t_name: [None or e_data]}}) # else: # task_result['task'][t_name].append(None or e_data) return task_resultdef prepare_runtime_context(task_ex, task_spec): 'count': len(task_ex.input[with_items_spec.keys()[0]]) } def calc_input(with_items_input): """Calculate action input collection for separating each action input. Example: DSL: with_items: - itemX in <% $.arrayI %> - itemY in <% $.arrayJ %> Assume arrayI = [1, 2], arrayJ = ['a', 'b']. with_items_input = { "itemX": [1, 2], "itemY": ['a', 'b'] } Then we get separated input: action_input_collection = [ {'itemX': 1, 'itemY': 'a'}, {'itemX': 2, 'itemY': 'b'} ] :param with_items_input: Dict containing mapped variables to their arrays. :return: list containing dicts of each action input. """ validate_input(with_items_input) action_input_collection = [] for key, value in with_items_input.items(): for index, item in enumerate(value): iter_context = {key: item} if index >= len(action_input_collection): action_input_collection.append(iter_context) else: action_input_collection[index].update(iter_context) return action_input_collection def _get_result_key(task_spec): return (task_spec.get_publish().keys()[0] if task_spec.get_publish() else None) def is_iterations_incomplete(task_ex): return get_index(task_ex) < get_count(task_ex)

commit_message:
Backport keystone memcache backend from 5.0

Use keystone memcache pool backend in order to fix scalability and
failover problems. This change require to python-keystone based on
changes from 5.1


Change-Id: I6c5282530b21c07a990349bf72fdce21befea14d
Closes-bug: #1364401
Closes-bug: #1340657
Signed-off-by: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/84/143084/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if (match_count == 0) and resource[:after] handle_create_with_after elsif File.open(resource[:path], 'w') do |fh| lines.each do |l| fh.puts(regex.match(l) ? resource[:line] : l) end if (match_count == 0) fh.puts(resource[:line]) end
deleted_lines: File.open(resource[:path], 'w') do |fh| lines.each do |l| fh.puts(regex.match(l) ? resource[:line] : l) end if (match_count == 0) fh.puts(resource[:line])

subject: Remove sudo from resetswift command
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-31 02:25:08.000000000', 'files': ['doc/saio/bin/resetswift'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/254d226130853c5572e45a9712f029be66685f6a', 'message': 'Remove sudo from resetswift command

The resetswift command is required the root privilege when it executes
because first command, swift-init, is required it. Therefore in this
command it is not necessary to have sudo. So this patch removed sudo
from in resetswift.

Change-Id: I2f1a3830814e5ba3c967f42c1122b0fe1d4c742e
'}]
commit_message:
Remove sudo from resetswift command

The resetswift command is required the root privilege when it executes
because first command, swift-init, is required it. Therefore in this
command it is not necessary to have sudo. So this patch removed sudo
from in resetswift.

Change-Id: I2f1a3830814e5ba3c967f42c1122b0fe1d4c742e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/42/169142/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: find /var/log/swift -type f -exec rm -f {} \; umount /mnt/sdb1mkfs.xfs -f ${SAIO_BLOCK_DEVICE:-/dev/sdb1} mount /mnt/sdb1 mkdir /mnt/sdb1/1 /mnt/sdb1/2 /mnt/sdb1/3 /mnt/sdb1/4 chown ${USER}:${USER} /mnt/sdb1/*rm -f /var/log/debug /var/log/messages /var/log/rsyncd.log /var/log/syslogservice rsyslog restart service memcached restart
deleted_lines: sudo find /var/log/swift -type f -exec rm -f {} \; sudo umount /mnt/sdb1sudo mkfs.xfs -f ${SAIO_BLOCK_DEVICE:-/dev/sdb1} sudo mount /mnt/sdb1 sudo mkdir /mnt/sdb1/1 /mnt/sdb1/2 /mnt/sdb1/3 /mnt/sdb1/4 sudo chown ${USER}:${USER} /mnt/sdb1/*sudo rm -f /var/log/debug /var/log/messages /var/log/rsyncd.log /var/log/syslogsudo service rsyslog restart sudo service memcached restart

commit_message:
fixed tests in test_neutrounv2 to pass with random PYTHONHASHSEED

to work properly with random python PYTHONHASHSEED fixed
_deallocate_for_instance method - used set to store port
for deletion, as had done in deallocate_for_instance
neutronapi.API class
test_validate_networks_ex_2 - in except section,
checked separately that both networks are in
exception message, as order of networks couldn't
be predicted

Partial-Bug: #1348818

Change-Id: If38850486f8cb84ce0cb739de257027fc52ce692
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/00/160900/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ports = {port['id'] for port in port_data} for port in ports: self.moxed_client.delete_port(port) self.assertIn("my_netid2", six.text_type(ex)) self.assertIn("my_netid3", six.text_type(ex))
deleted_lines: for port in reversed(port_data): self.moxed_client.delete_port(port['id']) self.assertIn("my_netid2, my_netid3", six.text_type(ex))

commit_message:
Add a reference to python-heat on Debian platforms

On Debian family platforms, the python libraries are in a separate
package. During the install the deps are handled okay, but if you try to
upgrade the packages (by setting package_ensure to latest) it will fail
to upgrade python-heat causing a chain of dependency failures. This
resolves that by making python-heat explicit.

Change-Id: Icf5a649af868bf86134ccc213e766d8f8c2518d8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-heat refs/changes/10/169110/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $library_package_name = undef $library_package_name = 'python-heat'

commit_message:
Fix functional configure script

A recent change to devstack renamed lib/neutron to lib/neutron-legacy,
and this change updates the functional setup script to reflect the
change.

Change-Id: I5eb4b4052da4b0db128feb42feae50a8bc59f373
Closes-Bug: #1438426

commit_message:
Updated parsing of catalog to handle bad format

Don't assume that the service catalog is well-formed, added code
to safely parsing the catalog.

Parsing of region from service catalog has been fixed as well.
'region' has been deprecated in the Keystone V3 catalog in favor of
'region_id'. Fix how region is extracted by checking 'region_id' then
fallback to 'region'.

Change-Id: I9e027586847b7b7c0276e8c3ff6b73f06a32e2a5
Closes-Bug: #1424825
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/08/159308/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if 'type' not in service: continue available_endpoints = [endpoint for endpoint in service.get('endpoints', []) if region == _get_endpoint_region(endpoint)] if 'type' not in service: return None if service['type'] == 'identity' and not available_endpoints: available_endpoints = [endpoint for endpoint in service.get('endpoints', [])] return endpoint.get(endpoint_type) if endpoint.get('interface') == interface: return endpoint.get('url') for endpoint in service.get('endpoints', []): if 'type' not in service: continue _get_endpoint_region(endpoint) == region: if service_name: return service.get('name') == service_name def _get_endpoint_region(endpoint): """Common function for getting the region from endpoint. In Keystone V3, region has been deprecated in favor of 304 region_id. This method provides a way to get region that works for both Keystone V2 and V3. """ return endpoint.get('region_id') or endpoint.get('region')
deleted_lines: available_endpoints = [endpoint for endpoint in service['endpoints'] if region == endpoint['region']] if service['type'] == 'identity' and not available_endpoints: available_endpoints = [endpoint for endpoint in service['endpoints']] return endpoint[endpoint_type] if endpoint['interface'] == interface: return endpoint['url'] for endpoint in service['endpoints']: endpoint['region'] == region: if service_name: return service['name'] == service_name

commit_message:
Disable "Associate floating IP" when instance error

This patch disables the "Associate Floating IP" button when  instances
are in error state.

Change-Id: I3896139ae7663a50e9ee76a46ccf696e190438d5
Closes-bug: #1374576
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/64/135564/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if instance.status == "ERROR": return False if instance.status == "ERROR": return False

UT fixes yet to be implemented.

subnet with the net_id so as to enable IPv6 L3 routing

ipv6-gateway config and corresponding UT for this change.

'}, {'number': 7, 'created': '2015-03-03 14:00:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/66e08b56012df00d1a40f70549f6cefbaa419695', 'message': 'Support IPv6 Router

Allow router-gateway-set to work even without an assigned
subnet with the net_id so as to enable IPv6 L3 routing
using the assigned LLA for the gateway.

The goal is to allow for IPv6 routing using just
the allocated LLA address for the gateway port to be
used as the external gateway to connect to the upstream
router. For this purpose router-gateway-set no
longer has a requirement of an assigned subnet.

A new config has also been added to the l3_agent.ini
to allow the user to set a valid ipv6_gateway address
to be used as the gateway for the default ::/0 route

Unit test changes and additions reflect these changes.

Implements: blueprint ipv6-router
Change-Id: Iaefa95f788053ded9fc9c7ff6845c3030c6fd6df

'}, {'number': 17, 'created': '2015-03-17 17:39:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/62cc72a34423ef12536f3f441773c5fb7861eb49', 'message': 'Support IPv6 Router

Allow router-gateway-set to work even without an assigned
subnet with the net_id so as to enable IPv6 L3 routing
using the assigned LLA for the gateway.

The goal is to allow for IPv6 routing using just
the allocated LLA address for the gateway port to be
used as the external gateway to connect to the upstream
router. For this purpose router-gateway-set no
longer has a requirement of an assigned subnet.

A new config has also been added to the l3_agent.ini
to allow the user to set a valid ipv6_gateway address
to be used as the gateway for the default ::/0 route

If the ipv6_gateway config is not set and a gateway
is still created without a subnet, the gateway interface
will be configured to accept Router Advertisements (RAs)
from the upstream router so as to build the default route.

Unit test changes and additions reflect these changes.

APIImpact
DocImpact

Implements: blueprint ipv6-router
Change-Id: Iaefa95f788053ded9fc9c7ff6845c3030c6fd6df

commit_message:
Support IPv6 Router

Allow router-gateway-set to work even without an assigned
subnet with the net_id so as to enable IPv6 L3 routing
using the assigned LLA for the gateway.

The goal is to allow for IPv6 routing using just
the allocated LLA address for the gateway port to be
used as the external gateway to connect to the upstream
router. For this purpose router-gateway-set no
longer has a requirement of an assigned subnet.

A new config has also been added to the l3_agent.ini
to allow the user to set a valid ipv6_gateway address
to be used as the gateway for the default ::/0 route

If the ipv6_gateway config is not set and a gateway
is still created without a subnet, the gateway interface
will be configured to accept router advertisements (RAs)
from the upstream router so as to build the default route.

Unit test changes and additions reflect these changes.

APIImpact
DocImpact
UpgradeImpact

Implements: blueprint ipv6-router
Change-Id: Iaefa95f788053ded9fc9c7ff6845c3030c6fd6df

commit_message:
devstack: install and run ovs+ovn

This patch updates the devstack integration to install ovs+ovn from
source.  It creates the ovs, ovn, and ovn-nb databases and runs
ovsdb-server and ovs-vswitchd.  Once ovn-nbd and ovn-controller exist,
they will be run, as well.

This also includes some other assorted changes made while I was
getting this to work.

Change-Id: I8eb4f88aed2101f60382fb8307265154066dc482
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/52/168652/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Q_ML2_PLUGIN_MECHANISM_DRIVERS=ovn,logger
deleted_lines: # NOTE: The below should be uncommented once we have an # actual plugin to use which does something useful. # Q_ML2_PLUGIN_MECHANISM_DRIVERS=ovn # We have to disable the neutron L2 agent. OVN does not use the L2 agent. disable_service q-agt enable_service ovn

commit_message:
1373513 has been fixed, remove skip

Now that bug 1373513 has been fixed, lets try re enabling  this test and
see it works now. Since 1373513 didn't happen every time, will have to
run the tests a few times and check the logs to see if this is actually
safe.

commit_message:
Improve DVR scale performance

Only process floating ips on a router that are relevant to the agent
hosting the router (don't process floating ips assigned to a router
if the associated vm is not hosted on the compute node requesting the
router sync). In this way, the number of database calls made during
the DVR router updates is optimized to eliminate unnecessary
duplication of calls which return the same data or are made to get
data for routers which are not relevant to the sync_routers request
from the agent.

Change-Id: I4e8477bb61ffff164d2f3bbebb94e95a25838ce0
Partial-Bug: #1413314
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/10/150110/13 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _process_floating_ips(self, context, routers_dict, floating_ips, host=None, agent=None): if not agent: super(L3_NAT_with_dvr_db_mixin, self)._process_floating_ips(context, routers_dict, floating_ips) else: floatingip_agent_intfs = self.get_fip_sync_interfaces(context, agent.id) LOG.debug("FIP Agent ports: %s", floatingip_agent_intfs) for floating_ip in floating_ips: router = routers_dict.get(floating_ip['router_id']) if router: router_floatingips = router.get(l3_const.FLOATINGIP_KEY, []) if router['distributed']: if floating_ip['host'] != host: continue LOG.debug("Floating IP host: %s", floating_ip['host']) LOG.debug("FIP Agent : %s ", agent.id) router_floatingips.append(floating_ip) router[l3_const.FLOATINGIP_KEY] = router_floatingips router[l3_const.FLOATINGIP_AGENT_INTF_KEY] = ( floatingip_agent_intfs) def get_dvr_sync_data(self, context, host, agent, router_ids=None, active=None): requesting_agent = agent or self._get_agent_by_type_and_host( context, l3_const.AGENT_TYPE_L3, host) port_dict = dict() ports = self._core_plugin.get_ports(context) for port in ports: port_dict.update({port['id']: port}) vm_port = port_dict[fip['port_id']] fip['host'] = self.get_vm_port_hostid(context, fip['port_id'], port=vm_port) self._process_floating_ips(context, routers_dict, floating_ips, host, requesting_agent)
deleted_lines: def _process_floating_ips(self, context, routers_dict, floating_ips): for floating_ip in floating_ips: router = routers_dict.get(floating_ip['router_id']) if router: router_floatingips = router.get(l3_const.FLOATINGIP_KEY, []) floatingip_agent_intfs = [] if router['distributed']: floating_ip['host'] = self.get_vm_port_hostid( context, floating_ip['port_id']) LOG.debug("Floating IP host: %s", floating_ip['host']) # if no VM there won't be an agent assigned if not floating_ip['host']: continue fip_agent = self._get_agent_by_type_and_host( context, l3_const.AGENT_TYPE_L3, floating_ip['host']) LOG.debug("FIP Agent : %s ", fip_agent['id']) floatingip_agent_intfs = self.get_fip_sync_interfaces( context, fip_agent['id']) LOG.debug("FIP Agent ports: %s", floatingip_agent_intfs) router_floatingips.append(floating_ip) router[l3_const.FLOATINGIP_KEY] = router_floatingips router[l3_const.FLOATINGIP_AGENT_INTF_KEY] = ( floatingip_agent_intfs) def get_sync_data(self, context, router_ids=None, active=None): fip['host'] = self.get_vm_port_hostid(context, fip['port_id']) self._process_floating_ips(context, routers_dict, floating_ips)

commit_message:
Add metric_name field to nagios_wrapper

A single instance of the agent must have distinct instance names
This allows multiple check to be submitted as the same metric
  and later sorted by dimensions by the user.

Change-Id: I62ee3b011c83908a4175812929e3a21167abbaba
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-agent refs/changes/60/168460/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: metric_name = instance.get('metric_name', instance['name']) self.gauge(metric_name, 3, dimensions=dimensions) self.gauge(metric_name, status_code, dimensions=dimensions)

revisions:

Change-Id: I1be628ad6076069784b58224b3044ce3a23973fc
